New in and children's reading ideas

April is Suffolk Libraries Children's Month, a celebration of everything we offer children and young adults. Find out more →

Reviews, suggestions and lists of new books for children aged 0-11. We have recommendations for readers aged 11+ in our Young Adult section.

New children's books for November 2018

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 30, 2018

This month's list features lots of snow and ice-themed books for winter.

Find your new favourite fiction or non-fiction book with the Blue Peter Book Awards longlist

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 25, 2018

The longlist for the 2019 Blue Peter Book Awards has been announced. Reserve a nominee today and see what you think.

Celebrate Halloween with these thrilling books for children

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 22, 2018

Close the curtains, light the pumpkins, snuggle up and enjoy a satisfyingly scary tale or two.

Celebrate the Sutton Hoo roadshow with these fantastic Anglo-Saxon themed books for children

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 8, 2018

The Sutton Hoo roadshow is coming to several of our libraries over the next few months. We've picked out some of our favourite Anglo-Saxon themed children's books to mark the occasion.

Encourage your children's wellbeing this Libraries Week with some of our favourite uplifting books

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 8, 2018

Libraries Week runs from 8 - 13 October 2018. As this year's theme is wellbeing, we've put together a list of children's books that we find especially uplifting and fulfilling.

Pick up a quality read from the 2018 Books Are My Bag middle grade shortlist

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 5, 2018

The Books Are My Bag Readers Awards are curated by bookshops and voted for by book lovers. Young book fans are invited to vote for their favourite for the chance to win a £100 book token, so why not check out the middle grade shortlist today?

Celebrate National Poetry Day with some brilliant verse for children

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 4, 2018

4 October 2018 is National Poetry Day. Organisers Forward Arts Foundation have chosen 12 children's poetry books to read aloud and enjoy.

Check out the latest super-readable titles from Barrington Stoke

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 3, 2018

Barrington Stoke, who specialise in books for children with dyslexia and visual stress, have published more brilliant titles recently.

Mark Black History Month with these top children's titles

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 1, 2018

October is Black History Month. We've marked the occasion by picking out some of our best titles for children about iconic and inspiring people of colour.

New children's books for October 2018

Written by Sophie Green · Published Sep 28, 2018

New titles for fans of the Diary of a Wimpy Kid, Tom Gates and Murder Most Unladylike series.

More Children's books

  • Brandon Library choose: The Twits, by Roald Dahl & Quentin Blake
  • Woodbridge and Lowestoft libraries choose: Tom's Midnight Garden, by Philippa Pearce
  • Bury St Edmunds Library choose: The Secret Garden, by Frances Hodgson Burnett
  • Haverhill Library choose: Oi Dog!, by Kes & Claire Grey & Jim Field
  • Aldeburgh Library choose: Another Year of Plumdog, by Emma Chichester Clark
  • Check out a brilliant children's book from the 2019 Little Rebels Award shortlist
  • Mildenhall Library choose: The Wonky Donkey, by Craig Smith & Katz Cowley
  • Framlingham Library choose: Owl Babies, by Martin Waddell & Patrick Benson
  • Hadleigh Library choose: The Cat in the Hat, by Dr Seuss
  • Halesworth Library choose: Potkin and Stubbs, by Sophie Green & Karl James Mountford
